verses.verse: O LORD of hosts, ((Ps. 2:12; 40:4)) Blessed is the man who trusts in You!

(Prayer that the LORD Will Restore Favor to the Land) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm (Ps. 42:title) of the sons of Korah. [1] LORD, You have been favorable to Your land; You have (Ezra 1:11â€”2:1; Ps. 14:7; Jer. 30:18; 31:23; Ezek. 39:25; Hos. 6:11; Joel 3:1) brought back the captivity of Jacob.
You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; You have covered all their sin. Selah
You have taken away all Your wrath; You have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.
(Ps. 80:3, 7) Restore us, O God of our salvation, And cause Your anger toward us to cease.
(Ps. 79:5) Will You be angry with us forever? Will You prolong Your anger to all generations?
Will You not (Hab. 3:2) revive us again, That Your people may rejoice in You?
Show us Your mercy, LORD, And grant us Your salvation.
I will hear what God the LORD will speak, For He will speak peace To His people and to His saints; But let them not turn back to folly.
Surely (Is. 46:13) His salvation is near to those who fear Him, (Hag. 2:7; Zech. 2:5; (John 1:14)) That glory may dwell in our land.
Mercy and truth have met together; (Ps. 72:3; (Is. 32:17); Luke 2:14) Righteousness and peace have kissed.
Truth shall spring out of the earth, And righteousness shall look down from heaven.
((Ps. 84:11; James 1:17)) Yes, the LORD will give what is good; And our land will yield its increase.
Righteousness will go before Him, And shall make His footsteps our pathway.
(Prayer for Mercy, with Meditation on the Excellencies of the LORD) A Prayer of David. [1] Bow down Your ear, O LORD, hear me; For I am poor and needy.
Preserve my life, for I am holy; You are my God; Save Your servant who trusts in You!
Be merciful to me, O Lord, For I cry to You all day long.
